content.rendered:
In math they told me numbers

have each a separate value,

making up tables.

They never told me numbers meant positions

meant igniting fear

in children who learn to walk

make judgement

of who comes first.

They told me that numbers were the basis of universe

but they never told me they could weigh humanity down,

the way they do.

We are not in need of tables anymore, we’re in need of change

and that will make a difference.

In geography they told me land,

is the part of earth

on which kingdoms were built

and crops were bred.

They never told me that land meant fear

meant families getting exiled, poison

between brothers with labyrinth of blurry memories.

They told me land was the basis of all independence

but they never told me

it could weigh humanity down,

the way it does.

The world doesn’t need more maps,

it needs a society,

a league,

a union,

and that’ll make a difference.

In literature they taught me words,

are elements of speech

forged into verity.

They never told me that words meant restraint

for the wives in the scullery

and the children of ‘less’,

abandoned of speech.

They told me to be careful with words,

once said can be only forgiven,

but never forgotten.

But they never told me that words

are denied voice

and even words could weigh humanity down,

the way they do.

We are not in need of words, we’re in need of voice.

And that will make a difference.

Inspired by Brittany Atkinson

Priya Rathod

IT, 4th Sem.

They never told me numbers meant positions meant igniting fear in children who learn to walk make judgement of who comes first. They told me that numbers were the basis of universe but they never told me they could weigh humanity  […]

content.rendered:
The dead have fallen.
Now she wishes to claim the throne.

Her beloved persons have been killed.
Now she feels alone.

She is now filled with rage.
She has burned the people of every age.

Their ashes are now flying;
And those who believed in her are crying.

The city has fallen and so has her reign.
Those who survived are drowned in the riverof sorrow and pain.

The one who freed people from the fire of vengeance
Is left to get rotten in the prison waiting for the death sentence.

There is no throne left in the world which can be stolen.
The history has repeated itself and the wheel is broken.

The song of ice and fire is written well.
For eternity, in the hearts of people, it will dwell.

Lokesh Narwani

EC, 5th Sem.

content.rendered:
I’m an alien,
One born on earth.
I don’t fit in, I don’t stand out;
Among the humans around.
I’m a concoction of good and evil,
Complete with a pinch of envy.
Being alone and adrift
Is in my job description.
They misunderstand my motives.
Take me for a fool.
Most talks start with-
“I didn’t mean to.”
Some judge, others appreciate;
Some look away, some befriend.
Aliens do exist.
They might be right beside you.
A little bit of research,
That’s all it takes;
To find the human within.

Khadija Sidhpuri

CE, 3rd Sem.

content.rendered:
I’m lying on the bed of grass in this cold night,
Under the mingled branches of trees.
The blue and bright moon is soothing my sight
And also taking me away from all the worries.
The peaceful rush of birds toward their nest
Seems to me like a home-coming fest.
This place, where I’m lying, is encircled by the calmness of paradise.
Also, with peace in the heart everyone looks nice and wise.
Enjoying the symphonic serenity everyone went calm.
This symphony also makes the cockles of my heart warm.
At the end, everyone went to sleep with peace.
So that tomorrow they can rise again with an ease.
The struggling day turned into peaceful evening and then to night.
With first rays of sunlight for a peaceful life again begins the fight.

Lokesh Narwani

EC, 4th Sem.

The peaceful rush of birds toward their nest Seems to me like a home-coming fest. This place, where I’m lying, […]

content.rendered:
Let me encounter dark nights again,
When you swing around my brain.
Let’s travel to the amazing heartland,
And I shall never leave your charming hand.
Let me encounter the dark nights again,
When you unknowingly make me insane.
Let me expect a grand surprise,
And smash me with your lethal eyes.
Let me encounter the dark nights again,
When I just forget all the pain.
Let’s stroll together a mile,
Where I shall adore your pleasant smile.
Let me encounter the dark nights again,
When I sense drizzles of the rain.
Let’s have a ride over brisk air,
Which shall flutter your glossy hair.
Let me encounter the dark nights again,
When I converse with my tranquil pen.
My heart often seeks to recite,
And emotions force me to write.

Sabir Pilludiya

CE, 6th Sem.

Let me encounter the dark nights again, When you unknowingly make me insane. Let me expect a grand surprise, And smash me with your lethal eyes. Let me encounter […]

content.rendered:
Save a drop and let the rest flow.
Of the rain, flooding up in you.
Take a break and dive deep down.
Spread your arms, reveal all your founds.
Float along the songs of silence.
Played by a fool, stuck in trance.
Swin through the nights of dark and horror.
Break down walls of self defence.
Drown in songs and rain.
Save a drop and swim again.
Mould your heart and let it pulsate.
Cause till 15th, we wait.
You’re an artist, beautifully disturbed.
Higher nights,
Moonlight bright.
The highway sides we walk on by.
Some souls glee
While the others cry
The wheels roll while the tears dry.
Yet the drops break light.
The dripping trees fight,
To gaze down,
Upon your smile.
And wonder.
Was that the beat of my heart or a thunder?
You are an artist. Beautifully disturbed.

Priya Rathod

IT, 2nd Sem.

content.rendered:
The moment when you smile,
My heart stops awhile.
Oh! I miss it since a few days,
And it makes me glad always.

The moment when you stare,
And express so much care.
Oh! I miss it since a few days,
That never skip wondrous gaze.

The moment together we seat,
And talk about life, so sweet.
Oh! I miss it since a few days,
And it makes me amaze.

In the moment when we get to meet,
I won’t neglect your given treat.
I will meet you at sweet home,
Oh! My mom, Love you mom!

Sabir Piludiya

CE, 6th Sem.

content.rendered:
It was the month of July, I remember
That day had brought the rain along since dawn.
It had been evening already without a sight of light.
I stared awhile at the interminably pouring blue;
The site too cold to be at and I tried to look away.
Just then the duskycloud slid like a shroud;
To unveil glory of an evening star over the heavy hail.
And then followed a parti-coloured and flashy rainbow;
A perfect treat for the weary and teary eyes to soothe.
So dear was that beam of yours for the joy to my heart;
That I thought it was an angel from the heaven afar
Holding a torch for me which I loved more than ever!

Harshil Kapadia

CE, 6th Sem.

content.rendered:
She fell in love with a book.
It came as quite a surprise, whenever she turned a page,
Tears dwelled up in her eyes.
She wasn’t fond of people,
For her, their facades were just too thin.
She could see completely through them
To the skeleton beneath their skin.
The characters in the book swayed her,
In their way they lived their lives.
A simple breath was never normal,
It had to be a shudder, a tremble or a sigh.
The men were always riddled,
The women strong and slight,
And when push came to shove the later,
They always went out in a fight.
So she curled up in a corner,
With a book propped on her knees
And she shank into this dreamland,
She never wanted to leave.
Days and nights blurred together,
Words flying through her mind,
And when she was finished later,
She left her heart behind.

Shuvam Mahapatra

CH, 6th Sem
